verses.plain: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

tokens.t: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

verses.plain: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

tokens.t: Hear my words, O ye wise
and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

verses.plain: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

tokens.t: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

verses.plain: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.

tokens.t: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what
good.

verses.plain: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.

tokens.t: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.

verses.plain: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.

tokens.t: Should I lie against my right? my wound
incurable without transgression.

verses.plain: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

tokens.t: What man
like Job,
drinketh up scorning like water?

verses.plain: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

tokens.t: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

verses.plain: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

tokens.t: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

verses.plain: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

tokens.t: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God,
wickedness; and
the Almighty,
iniquity.

verses.plain: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

tokens.t: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to
ways.

verses.plain: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

tokens.t: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

verses.plain: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

tokens.t: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

verses.plain: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

tokens.t: If he set his heart upon man,
he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

verses.plain: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

tokens.t: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

verses.plain: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

tokens.t: If now
understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

verses.plain: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

tokens.t: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

verses.plain: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?

tokens.t: to say to a king,
wicked?
to princes,
ungodly?

verses.plain: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.

tokens.t: that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all
the work of his hands.

verses.plain: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

tokens.t: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

verses.plain: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.

tokens.t: For his eyes
upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.

verses.plain: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

tokens.t: no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

verses.plain: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.

tokens.t: For he will not lay upon man more
that he should enter into judgment with God.

verses.plain: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

tokens.t: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

verses.plain: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

tokens.t: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth
in the night, so that they are destroyed.

verses.plain: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

tokens.t: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

verses.plain: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

tokens.t: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

verses.plain: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

tokens.t: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

verses.plain: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:

tokens.t: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth
face, who then can behold him? whether
against a nation, or against a man only:

verses.plain: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

tokens.t: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

verses.plain: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

tokens.t: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne
, I will not offend

verses.plain: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

tokens.t: I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

verses.plain: Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

tokens.t: according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

verses.plain: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.

tokens.t: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.

verses.plain: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.

tokens.t: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words
without wisdom.

verses.plain: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.

tokens.t: My desire
Job may be tried unto the end because of
answers for wicked men.

verses.plain: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

tokens.t: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth
among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

footnotes.text: the whole: Heb. all of it?
the mighty…: Heb. they shall take away the mighty
My…: or, My father, let Job be tried
